content.title: Intro
content.content:
1968
Preceded by
1968
1969
Year
1970
Followed by
1970

Tolkien-related events that took place in 1969.

content.title: January
content.content:
2 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letters 308 and 309.
6 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Paula Coston.
11 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 309a.
27 - Actor and author Cliff Broadway is born.
? - The first issue of Mythlore is published.

content.title: February
content.content:
3 - Shane Rangi, who would play several characters and lead the stunt crew of The Lord of the Rings (film series), is born.
? - David Salo, Tolkien Linguist, is born.

content.title: March
content.content:
6 - Scholar Gergely Nagy is born.
13 - Adam Tolkien is born.
15 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Amy Ronald.
20 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Amy Ronald.
? - Tolkien: A Look Behind The Lord of the Rings is published.

content.title: April
content.content:
8 - Actor Ian Hughes is born.
? - Mythlore 2 is published.

content.title: May
content.content:
7 - Producer Rick Porras is born.
14 - Cate Blanchett, who would play Galadriel in The Lord of the Rings (film series), is born.
20 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 310.

content.title: June
content.content: 30 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Paul Bibire.

content.title: July
content.content:
8 - J.R.R. Tolkien is diagnosed with an inflamed or diseased gall-bladder. Dr. Denis Tolhurst forbids him the consummation of fats (notably butter) and, in the eyes of the patient even worse, alcohol.
16 - Royd Tolkien is born.
19 - Voice actress Courtenay Taylor is born.
22 - Actor James Arnold Taylor is born.
31 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 311.

content.title: August
content.content:
1 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Mr Burrows.
5 - Actress Kim Mai Guest is born.
6 - Chris Edgerly, who would voice various characters in EA video games, is born.

content.title: October
content.content:
1 - Actor Charles Edwards is born.
? - The anthology The Young Magicians, which includes two poems by J.R.R. Tolkien, is published.
? - ‎J.R.R. Tolkien, a study by Catherine R. Stimpson, is published.‎
10 - Actor Manu Bennett is born.

content.title: November
content.content:
6 - Informal date of foundation of The Tolkien Society.
7 - Vera Chapman announces the foundation of The Tolkien Society in the New Statesman.
16 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 312.
25 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 313.

? - Charles Leslie Wrenn, Inkling, dies.
? - Bored of the Rings is published.
? - J.R.R. Tolkien sells the film, games, and merchandising rights of the books The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings for $250,000 to United Artists.
? - First deluxe, one-volume edition of The Lord of the Rings by Allen & Unwin.[1]

content.title: References
content.content:
↑ Wayne G. Hammond and Christina Scull (eds), The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion, p. lii
Years
1966 1967 1968 1969 1970 1971 1972
